data.title: Famous People Born in January 1954
data.meta_description: Celebrate the birthdays of 67 famous people, historical figures and celebrities born in January 1954 like Howard Stern, Oprah Winfrey and Katey Sagal.
data.text:
Bob Menendez, American politician (Senator-D-New Jersey 2006-), born in New York City

Jan 1 F.R. David [Elli Fitoussi], French pop singer-songwriter ("Words"), born in Menzel Bourguiba, French Tunisia

Jan 1 Richard Gibson, British actor (Allo Allo! -"Herr Flick"), born in Kampala, Protectorate of Uganda

Cynthia Sikes, American actress (Flamingo Road; St Elsewhere), born in Coffeyville, Kansas

Jan 2 Dawn Silva, American funk and R&B singer (Sly & The Family Stone; Parliament-Funkadelic; The Brides of Funkenstein - "Disco To Go"), born in Sacramento, California

Jan 2 Glen Goins, American funk guitarist and singer (Parliament-Funkadelic - "Fantasy Is Reality"), born in Plainfield, New Jersey (d. 1978)

Jan 2 Henry Bonilla, American politician (US House of Representatives (R) from Texas, 1993-2007), born in San Antonio, Texas

Jan 2 John Barlow Jarvis, American Grammy Award-winning songwriter ("Love Can Build A Bridge"), touring and session pianist (Vince Gill; James Taylor), and recording artist, born in Pasadena, California

Jan 2 Lyudmila Borozna, Russian volleyball player (Olympic gold USSR 1972), born in Saint Petersburg, Russia

Marc Ysaÿe, Belgian progressive rock drummer and vocalist (Machiavel), born in Ixelles, Belgium

Jan 3 Ned Lamont, American businessman and politician, Governor of Connecticut (2019-), born in Washington, D.C.

Jan 3 Ross The Boss [Ross Friedman], American guitarist (The Dictators), born in the Bronx, New York

Eugene Chadbourne, American avant-garde jazz composer, guitarist and banjo player, born in Mount Vernon, New York

Bryan Hitt, American rock drummer (REO Speedwagon - "Keep on Loving You"), born in Center, Texas

Anthony Minghella, English director and screenwriter (The English Patient, The Talented Mr. Ripley), born in London (d. 2008)

Jan 6 Hans Robert Hiegel, German architect, born in Kaiserslautern, Germany

Jan 6 Norbert Hahn, German luger (Olympic gold GDR men's doubles 1976, 80; World C'ship gold 1975, 77), born in Elbingerode, Germany

Jan 6 Trudie Styler, English actress, born in Bromsgrove, United Kingdom

Jan 6 Yuji Horii, Japanese video game designer, born in Sumoto, Hyōgo, Japan

Alan Butcher, English cricketer (one Test England v India, scored 14 & 20), born in Croydon, United Kingdom

Jerry Vivino, American rock and R&B saxophonist (Max Weinberg 7; Vivino Brothers), born in Paterson, New Jersey

Lance Hoppens, American rock bassist (Orleans - "Still the One"; "Dance With Me"), born in Bay Shore, Long Island, New York

Saskia ten Batenburg, Dutch actress (Factory, Hunk)

Howard Stern

American radio personality and "Radio's Bad Boy" (WKRK, WYSP, WJFK), born in Queens, New York

Vicki McCarty, American author (Girlfriend's Guide to) Playboy playmate (Sep, 1979), born in Los Angeles, California

Jim Duggan, American wrestler, born in Glens Falls, New York

Jose Dalisay Jr., Filipino writer, born in Romblon, Philippines

Jan 15 Nikos Sarganis, Greek footballer, born in Rafina, Greece

Jan 15 Roger McLachlan, New Zealand rock bassist (Little River Band; Stars), born in Riverton, New Zealand

Morten Meldal, Danish chemist (2022 Nobel Prize for click chemistry), born in Denmark

Cheryl Bentyne [Benthien], American jazz singer and vocal arranger (The Manhattan Transfer, 1979-2023), born in Mount Vernon, Washington

Jan 17 Robert F. Kennedy Jr., American attorney (Natural Resources Defense Council), born in Washington, D.C.

Jan 17 Susan Kiefel, Australian lawyer and judge, born in Cairns, Australia

Ted DiBiase, American professional wrestler, born in Omaha, Nebraska

Jan 18 Tom Bailey, English rock vocalist, keyboardist (Thompson Twins - "Hold Me Now", "Doctor! Doctor!"), and record producer, born in Halifax, West Yorkshire

Andrew Hall, English actor (Butterflies - "Russell"), and theater director, born in Manchester, England ( d. 2019)

Jan 19 Cindy Sherman, American photographer and director, born in Glen Ridge, New Jersey

Katey Sagal

American actress and singer-songwriter (Married With Children - "Peg"), born in Los Angeles, California

Jan 19 Katharina Thalbach, German actress and film director, born in Berlin, Germany

Jan 19 Steve DeBerg, American NFL quarterback (Broncos, Chiefs, Bucs, 49ers), born in Oakland, California

Chris Lemmon, American actor (Brothers & Sisters, Duet) [or Jun 22], born in Los Angeles, California

Jan 22 Peter Pilz, Austrian politician, born in Kapfenberg, Austria

Jan 22 Tully Blanchard, American professional wrestler, born in Calgary, Canada

Edward Ka-Spel [Sharp] British avant-garde singer-songwriter (Legendary Pink Dots), born in London, England

Jan 23 Franco De Vita, Venezuelan spanish singer (Extranjero), born in Caracas, Venezuela

Jan 23 Richard Finch, American disco and rock bassist, songwriter and producer (KC and the Sunshine Band - "Shake Your Booty"; "I'm Your Boogie Man"), born in Indianapolis, Indiana

Jan 23 Trevor Hohns, Australian cricketer (Australian leg-spinner 1989), born in Queensland, Australia

Glenn Worf, American session and touring upright and electric bassist (Mark Knopfler), born in Dayton, Ohio

Jan 24 Jo Gartner, Austrian racing driver, born in Vienna, Austria (d. 1986)

Condredge Holloway, American CFL HOF quarterback (Grey Cup 1976 Ottawa Rough Riders, 1983 Toronto Argonauts; CFL Most Outstanding Player 1982), born in Huntsville, Alabama

Jan 25 Jan Sandström, Swedish classical music composer (Motorbike Concerto: Snowflakes), born in Vilhelmina, Sweden

Jan 25 Kim Gandy, American feminist, born in Bossier City, Louisiana

Jan 25 Ricardo Bochini, Argentinian soccer midfielder (28 caps; FIFA World Cup 1986; CA Independiente 634 games), born in Zárate, Argentina

Kim Hughes

Australian cricket batsman and captain (70 Tests, 9 x 100, HS 213; 97 ODIs, 17 x 50; Western Australia CA, Natal), born in Margaret River, Australia

Jan 26 Martin Dunn, British editor (Today)

Joko Ninomiya, Japanese martial artist, born in Yawatahama, Ehime, Japan

Jan 27 Peter Laird, American comic-book artist (Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles), born in North Adams, Massachusetts

Anicee Alvina, actress (Friends), born in Paris, France

Jan 28 Rick Warren, American pastor and author

Jan 28 Shawn Murray, American rock drummer (Mink Deville), born in New York

Dick Manitoba, American punk rock singer (The Dictators), born in New York City

Jan 29 Doug Risebrough, Canadian ice hockey center (Stanley Cup 1976-79 Montreal Canadiens) and coach (Stanley Cup 1989 Calgary Flames), born in Guelph, Ontario

Oprah Winfrey

American TV talk show host and actress (The Oprah Winfrey Show, Colour Purple), born in Kosciusko, Mississippi

Alides Hidding, Dutch singer-songwriter (Time Bandits), born in Schoonoord, Netherlands

Jan 30 Jochen Kowalski, German concert and operatic countertenor (Hamburg State Opera, 1984-present), born in Wachow, East Germany (now part of Nauen, Germany)

Adrian Vandenberg, Dutch rock guitarist (Whitesnake), born in the Hague, Netherlands

Jan 31 Faoud Bacchus, West Indies cricketer (West Indian bat late 70's), born in Georgetown, Guyana

About January 1954

How Old? 70 years old

Generation: Baby Boomer

Leap Year: No

Chinese Zodiac: Snake

Star Signs: Capricorn (Dec 22 - Jan 19), Aquarius (Jan 20 - Feb 18)
